title: Preface
text:
This book is collection of topics from the R programming language. It’s organized more like a journal than a textbook, and each topic is centered around a problem or error I’ve encountered while developing R packages, data visualizations, functions, and shiny applications.
Some of the topics I’ve considered adding to this book have been already been covered (with more style and depth) in either the R inferno or What they forgot to teach you about R. If there’s any duplication of content, it’s presence should only indicate this topic was especially difficult for me to grasp, even after consulting these resources (multiple times).
This book was written in Quarto (learn more about Quarto books).

title: Introduction
text:
Using Git
Basic knowledge of Git has become somewhat necessary when you decide to enter the R ecosystem (or other open-source projects). I won’t be diving into Git commands here, but I will cover what commands I used to store and publish this book.

Create a repository on GitHub.com like this one: mjfrigaard/eRrata
Add and commit the files in the book repo:

git add -A
git commit -m "first commit"

Push the local repo to GitHub repo

git remote add origin git@github.com:mjfrigaard/eRrata.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main
